args: Hinomoto is an island country that exists\nfar from Alberia. And from this distant land\ncomes a lone visitor to the Halidom...
Well, I guess that's all of your bags.\nIs there anything else I can help with?
You have provided more than enough\naid, Prince {player_name}.
Pray allow me to introduce myself anew.\nMy name is Sazanka, and I am\nan attendant of the Twelve Wyrmclans.
I have come to Alberia at the behest of\nMaster Ieyasu for a cultural exchange.
I would be most delighted if I could teach\neveryone here the culture of Hinomoto.
I've been looking forward to this ever\nsince Ieyasu suggested it.
Indeed. Hinomoto culture is so deep,\nand there is much I wish to learn.
Me too! Let's start with games.\nYou guys play tons of games, right?
Aw man, I'm getting all antsy.\nI gotta play something now!
In that case, permit me to teach you\nsomething simple we can try right away.
Please do! I can't wait anymore!
Then let us start with a ＂renga＂\npoetry collaboration.

In this game, one player recites the
first stanza while the other recites
the second. Taken together, these
create a single waka.
I have NO idea what you just said.
Here we go!\n＂Though outside...\nThe Hinomoto nightingale...＂
Bird! Moonlight! Apple pie!\nI HAVE NO IDEA WHAT I'M DOING!
It's simple! Now you say, ＂the nightingale.＂
Can we please do something else?
Mmm. Perhaps that WAS a bit complex.\nLet us try composing a simpler waka.
This is a game where we insert seasonal\nwords as we recite poetry. I will begin.\n＂The flower...＂
I fear I do not understand the rules of\nthis particular game either.
Well, perhaps the universal language\nof music would be a better starting point.\nI have some instruments here in my bag.
This is a koto. One plays it by simply\nplucking at the strings like so...\n♪♪♪
Yesss! Finally, something I can handle!\nCan I try it out?
...Yeah okay, that was terrible. I mean,\nit made NOISE, but not like what you did.
It seems this instrument takes some skill.\nWould you teach us, Sazanka?
Of course. As you pluck, you lightly shake\nthe strings with your left hand. By\nlessening the tension, you create more—
Yeah, this ain't somethin' a person can\njust pick up in one go.
Ha ha! Apparently not. Maybe we can just\nsit back and let Sazanka play for us.
Certainly. I think I know the perfect song...
...Well, THAT was an incredible afternoon.\nWe had a koto concert, poetry lessons,\nand even a martial-arts demonstration!
Ya do all that stuff like it's no big deal,\nSazanka, which MAKES it a big deal!
Yeah, but HOW?! How can one person\nbe so good at...at EVERYTHING?!
As one born into a warrior household,\nI have trained in such arts my entire life.
From the time I was small, I was expected\nto be a master of any and all art forms.
A warrior household, hmm? That must be\nlike our concept of a knight's lineage.
My family has served Master Ieyasu's\nfamily for generations.
My purpose in life was settled\nthe moment I was born.
Such loyalty is admirable, in its own way.
And ya never thought about lookin' for\nsome other path? Not even once?
In Hinomoto, those born to warrior\nhouseholds spend their lives carrying\nout their duties.
I am proud to serve Master Ieyasu.\nThose who are frivolous about such\nservice deserve only the pain of death.
Gya! I'm sorry! Don't pain of death me!
Okay, I getcha. Sorry 'bout that.\nDidn't mean no disrespect or nothin'.
We've all been standing for some time.\nPerhaps we should take a load off.
Can I make you some tea, Sazanka?
Where might the kitchen be, Cleo?\nI would like to teach you about the\nHinomoto tea ceremony.
She went from talking about inflicting\nthe pain of death to brewing up tea?!\nWhat a weirdo.
Loyalty is clearly very near and dear to her.\nEveryone has such standards in their life.
You're right, Elly—and it really makes me\nwant to get to know her better.
There's a lot of exciting stuff waiting for\nus in this cultural exchange!
